proposals.title: Help Our Club Play the Fastest Game on Earth
proposals.shortDescription: Right now our table tennis club is predominantly a spectator sport. The 30+ students that routinely come to play are currently spending most of the 90 minutes waiting to play on a single table...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need two ping pong tables that can fold and roll to stow in storage.
proposals.synopsis: Right now our table tennis club is predominantly a spectator sport. The 30+ students that routinely come to play are currently spending most of the 90 minutes waiting to play on a single table that we have constructed by pushing three smaller tables together. <br/><br/>My students are table tennis novices but are already talking about playing in tournaments. They have no shortage of energy and dedication, despite a state and a district that has been failing them  financially. Because of budget cuts, this table tennis club is one of the only after school activities available at our school, and it is here solely due to student interest. They have taken to this club from the beginning of the semester when thirty of them showed up after school just to learn the rules. Their loyalty and their excitement is what makes me want to find new resources for them. They deserve to play ping pong and not just to watch. <br/><br/>The major benefit to having these two tables will be the ability to conduct tournaments in a reasonable amount of time. With our current set-up, a tournament involving all of our members takes between two and three hours. With these two tables we can easily complete a tournament in the 90 minutes we have available. Also, in addition to allowing more people to play, these tables will be regulation size, unlike the "table" we constructed out of three school desks. <br/><br/>Although nobody would say that the funding problem in our district is evidenced primarily by a lack of ping pong clubs, I think the lack of extracurricular activities in impoverished school districts is more of a problem than it first seems. These after school activities draw students to school and are significant times that students often remember more than individual classes. It's not that the core subjects don't matter, but our school hasn't lost its core subjects--it's lost its clubs

proposals.title: Soccer Supplies For A Growing Program
proposals.shortDescription: The soccer program at our school is growing every season. We have extremely committed student athletes in both the boys and girls programs. The addition of these balls would help us continue to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 20 soccer balls for practicing and playing.
proposals.synopsis: The soccer program at our school is growing every season.  We have extremely committed student athletes in both the boys and girls programs.  The addition of these balls would help us continue to build our ball handling, shooting and passing abilities. <br/><br/>Our high school is a selective enrollment math and science academy located in West Englewood, and my students commute from all over the South Side to come here. My students are 69.2% African American and 25.7% Hispanic, over 69% qualify for free or reduced lunch. They are hardworking and determined to reach their goals. They challenge themselves, and they like to be challenged in every way possible. <br/><br/>As we move into the fall, the other soccer coaches and myself created a soccer class that is offered on our enrichment day.  Due to student demand we need additional soccer balls.  These materials would be used during the school day as well as for students who dedicate their after school time to soccer. <br/><br/>This project will allow our learners to better build the skills that allow them to fully appreciate the great sport of soccer.  I am fortunate to teach and coach at a school where students go out of their way to support their peers.  Deepening their skill set will allow them to fully appreciate the importance of playing together on the field and how it impacts their teams performance.  Being able to generalize this skill will enhance their opportunities to work collaboratively in their lives.

proposals.title: Ditch the Desks & Make Our Learning Mobile!
proposals.shortDescription: The classroom is a wonderful place to learn, but on warm spring days sometimes you just need to go outside for a change of scenery. Many students, and sometimes even the teacher, just need to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a class set of clip boards to make our lessons portable, sidewalk chalk for outdoor lessons, and graphing mats for life size graphic organizers!
proposals.synopsis:
The classroom is a wonderful place to learn, but on warm spring days sometimes you just need to go outside for a change of scenery. Many students, and sometimes even the teacher, just need to MOVE! We can learn outside, on the floor, or even in the hallway! Learning no longer means desk work! <br/><br/>My students are an extremely enthusiastic group of fourth graders that share in my love of movement and fun! I encourage singing, dancing, making up cheers, and any else that makes learning easier! In our classroom we will do whatever it takes to learn the material and master important skills, and if that means ditching our desks and heading out on the move, then that is what we shall do! <br/><br/>My students will use the clipboards daily! Students will have the option to "work around the room" with clipboards and will not be tied down to their desks. If we want to work in a circle on the floor during reading centers instead of at the reading table, then using these clipboards will provide us with this option. If we want to work outside under a tree this spring, then we will pack up our work on a clipboard and head outside! 

Sidewalk chalk is a great teaching tool! Why use pencil and paper when the weather and our blank sidewalks are calling our names? Otherwise tedious long division and 2 by 2 multiplication becomes a super-fun work of art that students actually enjoy practicing! We can practice geometry, addition, subtraction, and so much much more with sidewalk chalk!

Lastly, using the graph mats we will turn flat paper Venn diagrams and graphs into life-size graphic organizers! These are also waterproof, so they are portable enough to go outside and be used on the ground <br/><br/>Sitting in a chair all day long writing on paper at a desk is just not for everyone. Every once in a while, students simply need to move, and maybe just need a change in scenery. Springtime not only means beautiful, warm weather, but it also means state testing time to us. Being able to use these materials and get out of our seats will really help to ease testing anxiety and provide an alternate way to study!

proposals.title: Compost Cafe
proposals.shortDescription: My students have very limited exposure to anything outside of the city. Their poor lifestyle doesn't allow them to experience how the waste of their food has a major affect on our entire society....
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need to experience how composting helps conservation and the chances of growing organic foods.
proposals.synopsis: My students have very limited exposure to anything outside of the city. Their poor lifestyle doesn't allow them to experience how the waste of their food has a major affect on our entire society. <br/><br/>My grade 5 students are very ambitious learners with limited opportunity to experience lifestyles outside of the city. They are given free breakfast and lunch because of the very poor area. Our school does not have a way to show the students how their waste can help to improve the growing process. With the compost we will plant flowerbeds so the students can see what their waste can become. They need to see how a lot can be gained from the waste we create. <br/><br/>Students will be able to plant a garden (hopefully for mother's day flowers). Through the process of learning how garbage can be turned into nutrients for plants students will can knowledge about how gardening can promote healthy eating and save the environment. Because all the food they receive at school is free they don't have any understanding of how their wastefulness is not helpful to their health or a sustainable environment. <br/><br/>This project will allow students to have the opportunity to work in cooperative groups while learning to save the environment. The chance to be outdoors and gain pride in their accomplishment of growing their own garden, something they may never get the chance to do because of their living environment.

proposals.title: Trying to Keep Up with the Technology World for P.E.
proposals.shortDescription: A typical day in my classroom/gym looks like a lot of students engaged but there aren't any technology resources for the students to use to stay current with 21st century skills when they come to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a mini iPad for P.E.
proposals.synopsis:
A typical day in my classroom/gym looks like a lot of students engaged but there aren't any technology resources for the students to use to stay current with 21st century skills when they come to my class.     <br/><br/>My students are awesome. They're from different cultures from around the world. 
My school has a very high rate of free and reduce students. Our teachers are committed to not using that as an excuse to feel sorry for the students when they're capable of learning and being more than what is expected of them. <br/><br/>Students will use the iPad to as a part of stations for research projects, to use the wonderful apps to explore and discover more details about a certain topic. They will use the iPad to take pictures during P.E. to be use as a guide to assess other student movement techniques like throwing, catching, etc.  Later in the future the students will be allowed to post video and pictures to social media for their parents to check out.  The pad will also be used for students to keep track of their mile times without using paper. <br/><br/>This will help instill responsibility in students because they will be in charge of taking pictures, video-recording, and assessing each other. A great thing for students to learn is to hear feedback from their students.  When students are able to watch themselves on video at home for their parents to see, they will want to do better to achieve high standards.  The iPad for the students will allow them to see the many functions it has beyond looking on the web.  An iPad used for P.E sounds awesome.

proposals.title: Spark!
proposals.shortDescription: "Spark" author John J. Ratey says, "The reason we feel so good when we get our blood pumping is that it makes the brain function at its BEST!" My 23 active 3rd grade students are lively and...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need exercise equipment, like jump ropes, soccer balls, and more, to physically and mentally SPARK them each day!
proposals.synopsis: "Spark" author John J. Ratey says, "The reason we feel so good when we get our blood pumping is that it makes the brain function at its BEST!" <br/><br/>My 23 active 3rd grade students are lively and energetic. Every morning we exercise for 15 minutes to get our hearts and brains pumping. My students are all shapes and sizes and have varying abilities when it comes to physical activity, but they all seem to know and recognize the impact it has on their mental capabilities and focus! We encourage each other and want everyone to feel successful! <br/><br/>My students will be able to use all of the requested exercise materials for aerobic activities each morning. They love to jump rope, play dodge ball, and run. They like to time themselves to see how fast they can go! They are competitive, yet supportive of each other. <br/><br/>I believe that physical education helps stimulate brain function. I hope to see an improvement in my students ability to focus as we continue to exercise each morning, and work hard all day.

proposals.title: Learning Well
proposals.shortDescription: I am in charge of coordinating activities during Recess with no option for outside Recess or gym. We have the basics like; balls but because of the low ceilings, we don't use them. I have students...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 2 indoor basketball arcades and a set of fitness dice, for indoor recess.
proposals.synopsis:
I am in charge of coordinating activities during Recess with no option for outside Recess or gym. We have the basics like; balls but because of the low ceilings, we don't use them. I have students sitting around because they're bored or just waiting for the next activity. "Everything is Possible" <br/><br/>Our school is on the West-side of Chicago, we are in a gang-infested area and we try do everything to keep our students safe. We have the most humble, creative and energetic 6th-8th graders, that I don't want to lose to the gangs because they were bored.  We need options to keep them active, so we volunteer by opening up the school on Saturdays for open gym so our kids can play basketball but during Recess, it's not an option. During Recess students get 25 minutes before lunch to be active and unwind, however, due to space constraints and lack of man power we can not use the gym or have outside Recess. <br/><br/>The Indoor Basketball Arcades and Fitness Dice that I am requesting will help keep our kids active and safe. We would have more options during Recess and allow more kids to participate during our Saturday open gym. We participate in the Healthy Schools program and we hold a Gold medal and our kids are slowly adopting the healthy way of eating. The physical piece they have mastered yet, they have limited areas to release all that energy. I want them to continue feeling safe in their own neighborhood and not have to risk their lives going to the "other side" just to have somewhere to play. <br/><br/>Our kids love their school and make sure there isn't any graffiti, drugs or fights in our school. They have so much pride and we want them to continue feeling that way. 

Every man must decide whether he will walk in the light of creative altruism or in the darkness of destructive selfishness.
-Martin Luther King, Jr.

proposals.title: Teach Me Chess!
proposals.shortDescription: Have you ever seen the amazing chess players in the park, or during a funny animated film? My 5th graders have been BEGGING me to start a chess club and teach them chess. Problem is- I don't know...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need the opportunity to learn strategy while playing chess!
proposals.synopsis: Have you ever seen the amazing chess players in the park, or during a funny animated film?  My 5th graders have been BEGGING me to start a chess club and teach them chess. Problem is- I don't know how! The Chess Teacher sets will help my students (and me!) play with confidence.  <br/><br/>My 5th grade students come from high poverty situations. Our school has over 85% of the student population on free or reduced lunch. They are very bright and eager for learning opportunities. As I have stated already, they have requested to learn to play chess because they see the value in learning.  <br/><br/>I am requesting 15 sets of The Chess Teacher, so my students can learn this amazing game in the classroom. Each student will be able to play and learn strategy, while engaging with their classmates. The Chess Teacher is set up for students to learn the names, moves and will even help me become a better player!  <br/><br/>By learning to play chess, my students will be learning strategy, creating lasting relationships, and building confidence. This game is something students will be able to play well into adulthood.

proposals.title: Dancing for Decades
proposals.shortDescription: Knowing and understanding how ones body works is the key to a healthy and happy life. Dance class teaches healthy habits of body and mind. Help my students gain strength and flexibility as they...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need foam rollers, balance boards, resistance bands, and exercise charts to help with strength and flexibility training.
proposals.synopsis: Knowing and understanding how ones body works is the key to a healthy and happy life. Dance class teaches healthy habits of body and mind. Help my students gain strength and flexibility as they rehab from injury or desire to take their dancing to the next level. <br/><br/>Most of my students have little experience with the world outside of their project, building, and block. They have seen and experienced more than they are even mentally ready to handle. For some, getting to school, let alone graduating is a great achievement. In my New York based high school, finding the right in-road is necessary for a student's success. The arts provide that in-road for most of these students. They get excited about dance. They enter the dance program unsure of who they are and what they want to become. They end up getting excited about dance and therefore getting excited about coming to school and being successful. They take ownership of their choices and consequences and blossom as young adults. <br/><br/>By funding this project, you will allow our dance studio to have items for injury rehab as well as strength and flexibility training.  These items include stretching charts with colored pictures and descriptions for each of the students to follow according to their bodies needs.  My students will learn how to take care of their bodies after strenuous physical activity by understanding how foam rollers are used in myofascial release of the musculature.  These are the same items that professional athletes use to keep their bodies at optimum performance level.  By introducing the students to this equipment, it shows them how to keep their bodies "dancing for decades".  Students will learn about resistance band training since this project will provide students with both medium and firm bands. Students that are suffering from or recovering from injury will have a place in the dance studio where they can work on different exercises during class and rehearsal time if you fund this project. <br/><br/>My students will learn how to take care of their bodies and the importance of stretching and massage.  These items will allow the students to self-monitor their own progress as well as provide a space in the room where students can use the equipment before or after class or rehearsal.  Students will become aware of their own personal body needs as it relates to dance activity and general health and well being.

proposals.title: Bullies Be Gone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
proposals.shortDescription: A typical day in my classroom is having students engaging in hands on enrichment Health activities. I want my students to understand the importance of working out problems peacefully rather than...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need buttons and fabric puffy paint.
proposals.synopsis: A typical day in my classroom is having students engaging in hands on enrichment Health activities. I want my students to understand the importance of working out problems peacefully rather than always turning to violence. <br/><br/>My students attend school in Baltimore, Maryland. The school setting is located in the city and it is very diverse. There are twenty different languages spoken here. There are 1300 students enrolled in this high school. The school can have difficult days where there is an altercation among peers. We are trying to improve the atmosphere on a daily basis. Push for peace is the message this January. <br/><br/>The studetns will be working on an activity about Bullying and Peace. The health students will create T- Shirts with their own design/slogan. Student will wear their project on a Friday to represent Peace. The students will design their T-shirts using the puffy paint. The other group of students will create buttons representing anti-violence and NO -Bullying. The students will also. advertise their buttons. <br/><br/>This project will make a difference by visually showing the students the message of harmony in a diverse school. They will look at their peers  Artwork and expression. The anti-violence, Keep the Peace message will  powerfully be displayed amoung the Health classes walking throughout the school. The project is a PSA announcement that they created and will advertise.

proposals.title: It's Time to Play!
proposals.shortDescription: This is our first year in a brand new building. We love being here but we do not yet have everything we need. My students are a lively bunch. They love to move and play. They're full of energy! We...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need balls, bats, foam flyers, jump ropes, hula hoops, cones, and storage for their play equipment.
proposals.synopsis:
This is our first year in a brand new building. We love being here but we do not yet have everything we need. <br/><br/>My students are a lively bunch. They love to move and play. They're full of energy! We spend the day moving about the room engaged in tactile activities to best suit their energetic nature.  
Ours is a Charter School in a high risk area. Many of our students come in far behind grade level and our days are filled with serious lessons, hard work, and catching up. These kids work so hard everyday without much of a break. Our day is longer than a typical school. Students are in session from 8am-3:30pm five days a week. We only get about 20 minutes a day for recess. For that reason I strive to create activities and lessons that get the kids moving and talking with one another. I want them to enjoy school and look forward to coming to see me daily. <br/><br/>The materials we need are meant for FUN! Our students don't get much fun during the day. In addition, we DON'T have a playground. Our recess consists of games of tag, running, and rolling on a large paved circle at the back of the school. Due to the serious nature of our school day, the long hours, and the hard work the kids engage in everyday I would love to see them play hard too! All of the play materials would be used for our recess. They can play organized games of soccer, or enjoy playing with hula hoops and foam flyers in small groups. I can already envision them playing with the equipment and it's a lovely sight. <br/><br/>This project will change our school day completely. The students can look forward to playing games and having good fun to break up the monotony of the school day. The break for fun should help to reset their little brains and get them back on track for more hard work in the afternoon. I can't wait to play along with them this spring!

proposals.title: 21st Century TV for Specials!!
proposals.shortDescription: Every day my students come in and they are excited and ready to move! Our typical day is a warm up activity, main lesson that practices basic skills of the unit we are studying or students...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an HDMI TV to interface with the new technology we have received in the subject areas of art, music and physical education.
proposals.synopsis:
Every day my students come in and they are excited and ready to move!  Our typical day is a warm up activity, main lesson that practices basic skills of the unit we are studying or students demonstrate these skills in a game situation.  When class is over we review or discuss the things we learned. <br/><br/>I'm privileged to teach about 350 VERY active elementary students.  For a lot of our children school is the only time for them to learn what it is like to be part of a team and to discover special skills and talents they possess within themselves.  A shocking 85 percent of our students live in low-income neighborhoods and don't have the money or opportunities to participate in extra curricular activities! Physical Education class gives them a chance to develop and experience new skills, be part of a team, and learn about leading healthy lifestyles.  Every year I try to introduce new activities and equipment to my students to help them expand their learning about the importance of leading a healthy lifestyle.

In my school district, our budget for physical education resources is incredibly limited. <br/><br/>Technology has been an up and coming learning source for the physical education setting!  One of the things my students love to do during their fitness tests are technology stations such as the DDR, Xavix, and Wii Sports games.  My students also get the opportunity to use a variety of exercise machines such as the elliptical.  During fitness tests it is important to make sure ALL students remain active while not testing.  The HD TV can allow us to project an exercise video on the screen through our laptops and iPads for students to follow in small groups or as one large group. I strongly believe that the implementation of an HD TV would expand their learning and show students that there are many fun and exciting ways to exercise!   Videos can also be good for warm ups or instant activities and cool downs! <br/><br/>This project will improve my classroom because it provides another way for kids to exercise in school and also presents the idea that kids can use exercise videos at home as well!  Not every kid likes to go outside and play or shoot a basketball!   

I also would like to share the HD TV with fellow teachers such as art, music, and computers!  The HD TV can provide ALL specials classes opportunities to expand learning in their classrooms!

proposals.title: Kinect-Sthetic Learning
proposals.shortDescription: We like to learn and find fun and exciting ways to learn! We don't just use our eyes, ears and hands, but our entire bodies! I am a teacher in a 6:1:1 classroom in a middle school for students...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an Xbox 360 with Kinect and games as well as a controller and charger so they can learn and exercise together in class!
proposals.synopsis: We like to learn and find fun and exciting ways to learn! We don't just use our eyes, ears and hands, but our entire bodies! <br/><br/>I am a teacher in a 6:1:1 classroom in a middle school for students with special needs. We have adopted the TEACCH method in our classroom. The students have a variety of learning methods which we emphasize in the class, through setting up different areas in the classroom. <br/><br/>My students just had a visitor who brought the Kinect in to show the children in my class, and they loved it! The students had so much fun and all interacted with it in their own way. We will set up various times during the week where the students can earn Kinect time to get the exercise they need as well as learn about personal space, sharing, and cooperation.   <br/><br/>How could this project not make a difference with my students? Just seeing the joy on their faces as they played and say their body movements translated into actions on the screen was proof enough that I needed to post this project. If you donate you will be making at least 6 students very happy, and possibly countless more!

proposals.title: Wiggle While We Work!
proposals.shortDescription: Do you remember being 6 and 7? Everything is so exciting and interesting! In our classroom, my first graders are almost always on the move. Working, talking, solving, testing, thinking, comparing,...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need stability ball chairs so they can wiggle while they work!
proposals.synopsis: Do you remember being 6 and 7?  Everything is so exciting and interesting!  In our classroom, my first graders are almost always on the move.  Working, talking, solving, testing, thinking, comparing, you name, they do it! <br/><br/>My students attend a Title I school in an urban school district.  They love to come to school and tell stories, ask questions, and share ideas.  My students have learned to be flexible and forgiving with our limited resources.  They know that school is important and they work hard everyday to learn something new.   <br/><br/>Stability Balls will allow my students to get their wiggles out!  We try to move often in class, but we do have to sit and work at tables and desks.  This can be a struggle for a few of my students, but these stability balls will allow my students to move slightly while completing their work.  They will be able to satisfy their desire to be active with the need to complete their assignments.  Using the stability balls will increase their engagement, improve posture, and increase their time on task.  My students will be able to use the stability balls throughout the day for whole group, small group, and independent learning. <br/><br/>Keeping my first graders active helps keep them engaged and invested in their learning.  Increasing their movement throughout the day is a healthier alternative to sitting still and they will be able to improve their posture instead of slumping in a chair.  My students will be able to focus and take ownership of their learning.
proposals.schoolName: Dr Carter G Woodson Elementary School 160

proposals.title: PE To The Max - Soccer
proposals.shortDescription: So our students may not be at the playing level of team USA or Brazil, but they sure do love to play soccer, both the boys and the girls. With the weather getting warmer outside, we need to play...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need soccer balls and cushioned covers for PE class.
proposals.synopsis:
So our students may not be at the playing level of team USA or Brazil, but they sure do love to play soccer, both the boys and the girls. With the weather getting warmer outside, we need to play outdoors. So my request is to get several types of soccer balls for skill development and game play. <br/><br/>Our school is located in the heart of a large metropolitan city in Washington state. The setting is a culturally diverse school with students from 20 countries. They speak over 15 different languages. We serve over 220 kids. You can walk down our hallways and hear kids speaking Amharic, Tigrinya, Swahili, Spanish, Vietnamese, Chinese, Nepali, Somali, and Oromo, as well as many other languages. <br/><br/>The majority of our population has lived in the USA less than 2 years. Many of them have been here for only a few months. Some of our kids have not been in a formal educational setting before, let alone a PE class. They are fortunate, and will get to experience a quality physical education program at our school. 

Soccer is the most popular game around the world. Our non-American born students love to play it. Our kids can relate to one another by discussing, comparing, and bragging about their countries' national soccer teams. We have a comprehensive soccer unit in our PE class. We play indoors as well as outside when the weather is nice. But, we need indoor soccer balls to use when we play inside. 

The goal is to provide as many traditional American activities for our students as possible. One of the most traditional classes offered through the years has been PE. We'd like our kids to be introduced to such sports as football, soccer, weight training and fitness, volleyball, and baseball. <br/><br/>We know you care about kids and public education. My guess is you are passionate about soccer and physical education. So, please help us, help our students develop the passion for PE and lifetime fitness activities. Your donation will be greatly appreciated. Together we can make this soccer project become a reality.

proposals.title: I'm a Grazer
proposals.shortDescription: Students love to eat. What students choose to eat, how much of it, and why, will be more strategic after our food science class. The benefits of a nutritious and balanced daily diet will be...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need food dehydrators and portable skillets to make easy and nutritious meals and snacks to graze on all day long.
proposals.synopsis: Students love to eat.  What students choose to eat, how much of it, and why, will be more strategic after our food science class. The benefits of a nutritious and balanced daily diet will be learned through science experiments and kitchen assignments. <br/><br/>Our student population is predominantly on free and reduced-price lunch and come from families that are challenged with helping the student with homework (either due to language barriers and/or socio-economic factors). Despite the challenges students come to school with, our junior high school is still filled with a staff that is dedicated to student success. Students come early to our school because they can get free breakfast and feel safe away from their neighborhoods. They often stay and hang around and take the late bus for the very same reasons. <br/><br/>Students will be developing their own snack and meal products using our food science kitchens, various kitchen tools and the requested food dehydrators and electric skillets.  The food science class is a STEM driven and project-based learning curriculum that allows students to use kitchen equipment, available ingredients, and teacher guidance to make nutritious foods that students enjoy grazing on throughout their day. <br/><br/>Mrs. Michelle Obama has identified youth nutrition and activity as a focus for America for almost a decade now.  At our school, students are hindered socioeconomically as well as culturally when choosing healthy alternatives to high calorie, low nutrient foods.  The class brings forth awareness and empowers students to use ingredients that they have at home to make their own nutrient rich and balanced meals.

proposals.title: Mr. Gross Mouth For Health Class
proposals.shortDescription: Our students here at our school are 21st century learners. Health is a brand new subject to them at the elementary level, and they are taking off! Every single day they are wanting to know more!...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Mr. Gross Mouth.
proposals.synopsis: Our students here at our school are 21st century learners. Health is a brand new subject to them at the elementary level, and they are taking off! Every single day they are wanting to know more! <br/><br/>My students are scholars, they are explorers, they are entrepreneurs, they are scientists, they are authors, they are mathematicians, and here at our school every teacher supports them 100% of the time. We set high expectations at our school, and every day those expectations are being met and are being exceeded. <br/><br/>Learning about alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs is a requirement by the state of North Carolina in the new essential standards for Health Education. Mr. Gross Mouth will allow my students to see first hand the harmful and, quite frankly, disgusting effects of using smokeless tobacco, not only on the board and on their own technology, but they will be able to touch it and have that hands-on experience. <br/><br/>Health is an everyday lesson for the rest of your life. Every single day students will face decisions in regards to their health, and as they grow older peer pressure to participate in potentially harmful events will grow stronger and stronger. Students need to be informed. With Mr. Gross Mouth I hope to extend the knowledge to my students with the hope they will make healthy decisions.

proposals.title: Every Level Gets Great Reads!
proposals.shortDescription: We try to use every moment for learning. Our school emphasizes the importance of literacy. My biggest challenge is finding appropriate material for students reading below grade level. It is...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need two Google Nexus tablets and cases in order to access leveled readers appropriate for fifth grade students.
proposals.synopsis:
We try to use every moment for learning.  Our school emphasizes the importance of literacy.  My biggest challenge is finding appropriate material for students reading below grade level.  It is embarrassing for fifth graders to be reading books with little girls on the cover! <br/><br/>Our school takes pride in the school community.  We celebrate accomplishments and  cheer each other on.  We focus on the positives.  Students are accepting of differences.  The children are kind, cheerful, and helpful. We have a diverse population as well as a poverty status.  In spite of much adversity, our children all want to learn to read! <br/><br/>The Internet provides an unlimited number of resources for our students to find "just right reads".  In order to access these, we need Nexus tablets with protective cases so that even the lowest readers can be engaged at their level.  Hiding a book in your lap so your classmates won't notice the primary pictures on the cover is a reality for many children.  
The Nexus tablets will allow many children to read engaging stories, many through our regional public library system.  This would motivate them to use the service and continue to read at home.  Families will benefit by learning about the access also.  Students will have access to any book, any level, any time!  Using the technology is also engaging which motivates some of the most reluctant students.  Some children will also have the opportunity to use headphones with the tablets, allowing them to listen as they read along. Various apps available also allow students to record themselves and work on fluency. <br/><br/>The children's lives will be made better with this project because literacy is essential.  Providing ways to help every child learn to read is crucial for their success in future endeavors.  Students' self-concept is often tied to how they view their success in school.  Using the technology of the tablets to help children learn to read can help them emotionally, socially, and academically.

proposals.title: Preschoolers Studying Oral Health
proposals.shortDescription: Preschool is a fun place to play and learn, while making lots of friends. The students learn through playing at centers, while participating in 6 different themes throughout the school year. We...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need realistic props to engage in higher-level play during our make believe play block.
proposals.synopsis: Preschool is a fun place to play and learn, while making lots of friends. The students learn through playing at centers, while participating in 6 different themes throughout the school year. We are about to start our Doctor/Dentist theme! <br/><br/>I teach 15 wonderful students from various backgrounds. Many of my students are native Spanish speakers, so realistic props are important while teaching them in English. They love to play, so most of their learning happens during our make believe play block and they're excited to become doctors, nurses, dentists, patients, etc. <br/><br/>I'm requesting a realistic teeth model and large tooth brush for the dental office play center. This will allow the students to reenact exactly what dentists teach at their offices. I'm also requesting a dental hygienist uniform, doctor's office kit and the game operation. <br/><br/>I greatly appreciate you considering help fund this project because it will help my students tremendously to have access to these props. Preschoolers and English Language Learners learn best through play and dressing up in their roles.

proposals.title: Classroom in Nature
proposals.shortDescription: Real life experience adds multi-level educational values to adolescent minds. I have led groups of students, many times a year, into the wooded areas north of NYC to give them real world...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an educational compass kit to help them learn mountaineering and become confident and independent young adults.
proposals.synopsis:
Real life experience adds multi-level educational values to adolescent minds. I have led groups of students, many times a year, into the wooded areas north of NYC to give them real world experience with the topics they are covering in school. This program is called "Classroom in Nature". They love it! <br/><br/>Our students come from a huge NYC school (1850 students) that is one of the most culturally diverse in the country. Most are economically depressed and have problems getting the most basic supplies needed for school. The school gets little funding and has to make do with what is available.

Despite the inherent problems, the students are eager to explore and become interested in the world once they are introduced to it in unique ways. Through many donations our trips are funded, allowing our inquisitive students to be part of the "Classroom in Nature" series which encompasses all of their major subjects.  <br/><br/>I use many techniques to guide the students through the woods on these educational trips. The one that garners the most interest is the compass, topographical map, and using my mountaineering skills. They have repeatedly asked to learn the skills to move through the woods and understand the lay of the land better. This would instill within them a sense of pride, understanding, and independence. 

The materials are a learners kit (pack of 24) of compasses which would be used to teach them the orienteering skills utilizing the hands-on technique. <br/><br/>The skills and confidence that will be gained translate to many different areas of these students' lives. The new found abilities will help in the Earth Science classes with map skills which are necessary for the Regents Exam. The addition of expertise in this area will lead to a deep sense of self and self-reliance.

matchingFund.name: AT&T Foundation
matchingFund.description:
You can bring this project to life at half the cost!

The AT&T Foundation will fund 50% of this project if someone like you provides the remainder. By completing this project, you will double the impact of your donation.

At AT&T we believe that investing in education is one of the most important things we can do for a strong future. It's an issue that's important to us, our customers and our country. The support for DonorsChoose.org is part of AT&T Aspire, the company's $350 million commitment to education. AT&T is funding projects at schools that need it most, with the goal of equipping students with the tools necessary to graduate high school and succeed in college, careers and life.

See all projects eligible for this match offer.

proposals.title: Kinect Krazy
proposals.shortDescription: Many of my students go home from school and are sedentary in front of the television or video games. I am looking to expose them to a new way of using their video game systems for physical...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need games, like the Body and Brain Connection and MotionSports, for Kinect systems. We use the Kinect systems to integrate technology in our Physical Education classes.
proposals.synopsis: Many of my students go home from school and are sedentary in front of the television or video games. I am looking to expose them to a new way of using their video game systems for physical activity! I hope to foster a love of physical fitness in my students by incorporating their love of video games <br/><br/>The student population at my school is almost 100% economically disadvantaged. Our students are not provided with the opportunity to be involved in after school sports and activities, either because of their parents work schedules or financial difficulties. <br/><br/>I am looking to purchase Kinect Games for our Xboxes that I can use to incorporate technology in my gym. I want to teach the kids a new way to use those video games they love to get them off the couch and excited about physical fitness! With childhood obesity on the rise, we have to find a way to get our children excited about physical fitness. <br/><br/>The donation of these games will provide my students with the opportunity to be exposed to another way to use the video game systems they love to improve their physical fitness. With childhood obesity on the rise, we must look at finding a way to get these children up and moving!

proposals.title: Read to Ride
proposals.shortDescription: Two goals I have for my students seem to be at odds with each other. I want my students to be more active. I want my students to read. I think I have found a way to incorporate reading into a...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a recumbent exercise bike for classroom fitness activities and to encourage reading.
proposals.synopsis: Two goals I have for my students seem to be at odds with each other.  I want my students to be more active.  I want my students to read.  I think I have found a way to incorporate reading into a fitness activity, which will achieve both goals! <br/><br/>My students are typical American teenagers. They eat too much unhealthy food, they do not exercise enough, they watch too much television, and they are in danger of becoming overweight. We live in a relatively rural area and students do not have easy access to gyms and other exercise venues. Our school offers basic physical education courses, but not any sort of comprehensive fitness program. A recumbent bike would show my students another way to fit exercise into their everyday life, which is one of my goals for them.  Another goal I have for my students is for them to develop a love of reading.  Not just reading to study for a test, or because it is required for a class, but reading for the entertainment, relaxation, and the pleasure it can give. <br/><br/>It sounds strange, but what I envision with this project is my students engaging in physical activity WHILE they are reading.  With a recumbent bicycle, the students can comfortably ride while holding a book.  I have a small kiddie swimming pool full of young adult fiction books and magazines in my classroom, and I plan to place the bike beside the pool with a sign that says "Read to Ride."  Students will be instructed that in order to ride the recumbent bike (and they will want to--new equipment is very appealing), they must read!  Students will earn a double benefit--they will be exercising and reading--both activities that most students don't experience enough! <br/><br/>Donations to this project will help improve students' health and fitness by giving them access to a new piece of exercise equipment. It will improve students' academics by requiring extra reading. Any project that improves health and fitness and encourages reading will always have a spillover effect--healthier, more informed students always equals more productive citizens!

proposals.title: Let's Get Physical!!
proposals.shortDescription: Our Physical Education department requires 20 minutes of physical education daily. Its focus is on getting the students active by any means possible. We strive to make every child become healthy...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a variety of balls, jump ropes, and ball rockets.
proposals.synopsis: Our Physical Education department requires 20 minutes of physical education daily.  Its focus is on getting the students active by any means  possible. We strive to make every child become healthy and active. <br/><br/>My students are one of a kind. They are very high-spirited, while living in an environment that many may consider is not. My students are predominantly ELL learners and live in a very poor neighborhood, where about 97% are on free or reduced lunch. They are a very special group of kids. <br/><br/>My students need a variety of sports balls, jump ropes, and rocket balls due to the lack of resources my school has.  It is very often when the students are required to play the same sport over and over again.  This equipment will help with the diversity of games and physical activity that the children crave. With the various balls, jump ropes, and rocket balls, students can build their cardiovascular system and be healthier children.  <br/><br/>With this equipment, my students will get to experience different activities and sports that they may not have ever discovered before.  They will also have a new found love and appreciation for Physical Education.

proposals.title: Basketballs for Ladies in Training
proposals.shortDescription: Lady Panthers can play ball too! They show up to practice full of energy, passion, and a commitment to winning on and off the court. Our goal is to take back the District Championship Trophy! The...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 15 basketballs, pinnies, and a megaphone.
proposals.synopsis: Lady Panthers can play ball too! They show up to practice full of energy, passion, and a commitment to winning on and off the court. Our goal is to take back the District Championship Trophy! <br/><br/>The ladies on my basketball team are from grades 6-8, and come to me from some of the roughest neighborhoods in the city.  Most are on free and reduced lunch, and most can barely afford the right shoes to play sports. Despite their setbacks, these girls show up on time and ready to learn more. My dedicated team enjoys practice, as it gives them an opportunity to release some stress, while also building friendships with their peers. Their love for the game and each other are inspiring. <br/><br/>During practices this year, we have been limited to 3-5 basketballs that the PE department lets us borrow. Unfortunately, sometimes the balls are locked up and we must make due with the one or two that the girls brought from home.  This is no way to prepare a championship team! The 15 basketballs will ensure that every drill, every challenge, every scrimmage can run smoothly with plenty of balls to work with.  (The bag is to keep these balls together while not being used.)  The pinnies will allow me as a coach to run scrimmages without the frustration of my girls not knowing who is on their team.  I have borrowed these as well from the PE department, but they are often torn or there aren't enough for the girl's and boy's teams to use at the same time. The megaphone is simply so I will not lose my voice during practice. I'm useless as a teacher and coach without a voice! I'm hoping by having this equipment, I can streamline practices and ensure my ladies take home a WIN! <br/><br/>Playing sports has been shown to not only improve students' physical health, but also their self-confidence and interpersonal skills.  By providing my team with the equipment they need to adequately prepare for their games, I hope they will gain more skills and confidence in themselves. Practice makes perfect! So instead of WATCHING, they will finally be DOING!

proposals.title: Brain Food and a Germ Free Classroom
proposals.shortDescription: Kids' brains work best when their stomachs have something in them. Hunger gets in the way of learning and I aim to eliminate that distraction by providing them with daily snacks from caring...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need brain food in their tummies so they can concentrate on their studies. They also need to fight deadly flu germs with ample amounts of disinfectant wipes.
proposals.synopsis:
Kids' brains work best when their stomachs have something in them. Hunger gets in the way of learning and I aim to eliminate that distraction by providing them with daily snacks from caring donor's like yourself. It is hard to concentrate when your tummy is growling.  We need daily brain food. <br/><br/>Our school population consists of 90 percent of the families being on government assisted housing and free or reduced breakfast and lunch programs at school as well as free after school programs that also provide snacks.  We are the school with the highest population of impoverished children in our district.

I have found over the years that regardless of their economic disparity and many other difficulties, they still come to school with hopes and dreams of being productive members of society one day.  

Years ago, parents used to be able to contribute to our class snack pantry, but in recent years, those contributions have become a thing of the past.  It has now become a strain on my own finances to have to provide whole class snacks each day for the entire year.

I prefer to provide the entire class snacks so that everyone has something to eat each day.  Imagine a class where some kids who can afford to bring one eat while others who can't don't.  It is inequitable! <br/><br/>With full stomachs, children will be able to fully concentrate on their studies and not that growling tummy they would have had if they didn't snack.

Despite us being the school with the highest amount of families with economic challenges, we have also made great strides in achievement through the implementation of a district wide writing program in recent years.  We finally reached our 800 ABI status two years ago and maintained it last year.  We hope this year will continue to show a growth in scores.

This would be nearly impossible to achieve if hunger got in the way.

We also have great need for Disinfecting Wipes, to keep our desk tops cleaner and germ free.  Each Friday we clean our desks with wet wipes.  Trust me, it isn't often enough.  These wipes turn black every single week.  If I could afford to buy and use them more often, I would. <br/><br/>Graduates that come back to visit remember being fed in class and how they were able to contribute to keeping the classroom clean and germ free.

With the deadly flu outbreak this year, we need to do all we can to keep desk and table top surfaces clean in order to fight germs.  Feeding the children will contribute toward strong healthy bodies that can also fight those diseases.

proposals.title: Adding Fitness Routines In Our Classrooms
proposals.shortDescription: We are adding fitness through our longer school day. These fit cards will make meeting this goal easy, and the exercises require no equipment. Research proves that more than 20 minutes of sitting...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need quality fitness activities in the classroom for 30 minutes a week.  These cards require no equipment and will be easy for teachers and students to use!
proposals.synopsis: We are adding fitness through our longer school day. These fit cards will make meeting this goal easy, and the exercises require no equipment.  Research proves that more than 20 minutes of sitting decreases blood flow to the brain.  Getting up and moving through the day can improve  brain function. <br/><br/>Our students live in one of the biggest cities in America.  More than 90% come from low-income homes.  We are dedicated to providing them with a safe, high quality school.  Staff work long hours to meet the demands of modern public schools.  We aim to develop  all aspects of children, including their physical fitness.  Because of limited budget and facilities, students have physical education one period a week.  Kids love their physical education classes, but wish they could have more. <br/><br/>These Fit Deck cards will allow teachers in the classrooms to add physical fitness to each day of the week.  The cards have exercises that use body weight.  The beauty of the cards is that no equipment is required.  Each classroom in grades 1-8 will have their own deck of cards to use every day.  What a relief it will be to have concrete activities that non-physical education teachers can use with ease.  Our goal is to improve fitness, brain function, and add an element of fun to our day.  Everybody wins!  Please help us provide this quality exercise to our students. <br/><br/>Students and teachers will enjoy school more, while engaging in high quality, fun exercise.  In addition to moving more, students can lead these new and exciting activities.  They can even show me in gym class what they have learned.  We want to promote activity now and for a lifetime.  These cards will definitely help us meet the goal of students increasing their activity levels.

proposals.title: Getting Active and Healthy!!
proposals.shortDescription: According to CDC, children need at least 60 minutes of physical exercise per day. In the winter months, due to cold, wet conditions, it is not easy to get the necessary amount of exercise that is...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need jump ropes, bean bags, partner parachute kit, and swing and catch cups for physical activity.
proposals.synopsis:
According to CDC, children need at least 60 minutes of physical exercise per day. In the winter months, due to cold, wet conditions, it is not easy to get the necessary amount of exercise that is required for this age. <br/><br/>Our school is in a high poverty area, close to the Downtown, Southern California region. Due to the metropolitan neighborhood, most of our students live in apartment buildings, without back yards or safe streets and/or cul-de-sacs to play on after school hours. Many parents are working late, so local parks are often not accessible to most of our students. And this is only when the weather cooperates, since winter months are often cold and wet. <br/><br/>I am requesting jump ropes, bean bags, partner parachutes, and the like, which can be played indoors, requiring small areas to play, keeping the fun alive, while giving much needed exercise to our students. These fun and physically fit equipment will be very well utilized on rainy days, when the students do not have access to outdoor play within the school. 
I also plan to use these fun, mildly-competitive games as a part of the reward system, for those who can complete their tasks completely and accurately within time frames within the class. These games will keep the students active and moving within a structured setting. A special thanks to Jamba Juice for making significant efforts to the importance of keeping the children healthy and fit. <br/><br/>According to CDC Weekly, 2009 July issue, "Childhood obesity continues to be a leading public health concern that disproportionately affects low-income and minority children", and that continues to affect their health throughout life. It is vital that we start at a young age to teach exercise and staying active and healthy, as they seem to be starting at a disadvantage already by the statistics.

proposals.title: Lets Get Active 2!!!
proposals.shortDescription: A thirst of knowledge starts with a satisfied stomach. I would like to encourage my students to "get active" by supplying healthy snacks. I have 15 boys and 5 girls in my classroom. They come from...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need healthy snacks, water, and various hygiene supplies to hep our class "get active" with nutrition, wellness,  and fitness.
proposals.synopsis: A thirst of knowledge starts with a satisfied stomach.  I would like to encourage my students to "get active" by supplying healthy snacks. <br/><br/>I have 15 boys and 5 girls in my classroom. They come from poverty stricken neighborhoods. They come from various cultural and economic backgrounds. This offers a great challenge for me as well as for the students. It also offers a great opportunity for people to work together and learn about others and their way of life. My students attend an inner city Title I school that struggles to keep and maintain adequate equipment and supplies. <br/><br/>Water plays a crucial role in life processes where, it is used to transport food materials and other nutrients to body cells of all living organisms. The healthy snacks and various supplies will create a healthy environment that models and teaches positive methods of understanding food and it's effect on a body.  Our kids spends hours a day watching television and playing video games.  I feel that it is crucial to teach students how to take care of their bodies and provide them with opportunities to "get active".  My students work hard to try and focus on their academics everyday.  I find that the class does better and gets excited to have short physical brain breaks through out the day. <br/><br/>I love to keep my students excited, engaged, and motivated. Please help my students become fully engaged and excited lifelong learners! Your donations will make a tremendous impact on my students.  If they are given the knowledge to understand the world and the wisdom to change it, then the possibilities for the future are endless.

proposals.title: Playground Pleasures
proposals.shortDescription: My students love to play outside. We need playground equipment to add to the diversity of activities during play. Our school is a PreK-8th grade, Title I school in Washington, DC. We can see the...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need playground equipment: playground balls, hula hoops, rhythm ribbons, and other items to develop gross motor skills, practice social skills, and gain confidence as they try out new and challenging equipment.
proposals.synopsis: My students love to play outside. We need playground equipment to add to the diversity of activities during play. <br/><br/>Our school is a PreK-8th grade, Title I school in Washington, DC. We can see the Capitol building from our front door! My classroom is an autism inclusion, multi-age, Head Start classroom. That means we have children who are 3 and 4 years old, 6 of whom have autism and 11 of whom are typically developing. All of our children see the world as a wondrous place full of possibilities. We are helping them learn to express themselves in different ways - through spoken language, drawing, writing, building, painting, and music and movement. <br/><br/>My students will use these materials everyday! Playing with balls, hula hoops, rhythm ribbons, and stilts will foster gross motor development by facilitating running, jumping, kicking, skipping, rolling, and more! The children will practice social skills as they use the materials with friends and share them. The children will be challenged to try new things. They will practice persistence, creativity, and problem solving as they explore these new materials. <br/><br/>One of the joys of early childhood is exploring the outdoors and playing together. Donations to this project will allow the children to develop gross motor skills, practice social skills, and gain confidence as they try out new and challenging equipment.

proposals.title: Help Keep Kids Active at Recess!
proposals.shortDescription: My school is working to promote an increase of physical fitness at our school site. Our goal is to teach every student how to play organized sports by the end of the year. My students attend...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need basketballs, soccer balls, and kick balls, and bags to store them in for organized sports at recess and Physical Education.
proposals.synopsis: My school is working to promote an increase of physical fitness at our school site.  Our goal is to teach every student how to play organized sports by the end of the year. <br/><br/>My students attend school in an economically disadvantaged community.  We are unable to obtain funding to provide the necessary equipment for our students to be able to participate in organized sports during recess.   We have students who love to play sports, but are unable to because we need more sports equipment. <br/><br/>Our students are growing up in an age in which video games and television are keeping them from getting much needed exercise.  In addition to our healthy school lunches, we need to now encourage student physical fitness.  Our goal is to teach all students how to play organized games that promote teamwork, sportsmanship, and leadership.  We are also looking to make the most out of our recess time by encouraging kids to get outside, breathe fresh air, and play.  As students learn new games, we can put many of them in charge to lead the games for younger students.  This builds confidence and promotes student leadership.   <br/><br/>The most important things our students will take away from this is sportsmanship and physical fitness.  Our students need to work on sharing equipment, taking turns, and learning different ways to move.  Many of them associate exercise with discomfort or other negative points of view.   As a school we would like to see more students actively involved in recess games and sports to increase confidence and minimize inactivity as a whole.  This leads to a more positive school culture.

proposals.title: Take Us Off OurTether
proposals.shortDescription: I co-teach with another teacher in the gym. We have large classes all day. We try to get them all moving simultaneously and it would enhance our program to be able to walk to different parts of...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need to hear me while I am walking around the gym helping them.  The wired tethered system we have now does not allow us to engage the students.
proposals.synopsis: I co-teach with another teacher in the gym.  We have large classes all day.  We try to get them all moving simultaneously and it would enhance our program to be able to walk to different parts of the gym to give instruction. <br/><br/>Our students live in poverty.  They come in with smiling faces and do not like to miss their gym day.  They struggle to wear laundered clothes and rely on the food assistance that is provided.  Most live in single parent homes and some are being raised by aunts, grandparents, or family friends.  They have large families and extended families. <br/><br/>Our hands will be free to demonstrate juggling scarves, dribbling a basketball, swinging a badminton racket, or baseball bat.  We will be able to move to different parts of the gym to attend to disruptions and get students on task.  We will be able to attend to struggling students and to acknowledge the successful students. <br/><br/>The wireless hands free microphone will enhance our classroom by allowing us more freedom to move around addressing the students needs.  We won't be always running to the mic to talk or having to keep children from playing with it while we are elsewhere.  It will make a fun experience for us and for our students.  It will save our voices when we are away from the microphone.

proposals.title: Healthy Heart Habits!
proposals.shortDescription: An apple a day keeps the doctor away....What about an Apple iPad mini and case to increase knowledge about health and fitness as well as movement in my kindergarten classroom? My students attend a...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an iPad mini and case to assist their learning about health, fitness and wellness.
proposals.synopsis:
An apple a day keeps the doctor away....What about an Apple iPad mini and case to increase knowledge about health and fitness as well as movement in my kindergarten classroom? <br/><br/>My students attend a Title I school in the suburbs. They often do not go outside to play once at home and we have about 15 minutes of recess each day. I would like to encourage movement and physical exercise while learning in our regular day in the classroom. We have to find a way to fight childhood obesity and this starts with making exercise a part of each child's day and making it a routine activity. <br/><br/>Students will use the iPad mini and case daily to increase their movement and exercise in the classroom. They can use many apps that will tell students which movement to do and they can act those movements out. Students will also be able to make videos telling the importance of being healthy and exercising each day. We can then post these videos on our website and share with other classes.

Also, The USDA challenged software developers, game designers, students, and others to develop fun and engaging software tools and games that drive children to eat better and be more physically active. Some of the apps I plan to use in my class won awards from the USDA and include Pick Chow, Trainer, Fitter Critters, Smash Your Food, Food Hero, and Food Buster. <br/><br/>Your donations will help each of my students learn about health and fitness at an early age and understand the importance of taking care of their bodies and leading a healthy life. Thanks for making my students more active and healthy!

proposals.title: Staying Alive With Health And Wellness Supplies!
proposals.shortDescription: How many of us have written a little note to remind of us of our eating habits goals? You know, the friendly reminder there on your refrigerator! Imagine the impact a fully developed poster will...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need materials such as masking tape, letters and borders, to create and display Health and Wellness posters and bulletin boards.
proposals.synopsis:
How many of us have written a little note to remind of us of our eating habits goals? You know, the friendly reminder there on your refrigerator! Imagine the impact a fully developed poster will have on my students and school. 

 <br/><br/>My students face so many challenges, but they realize that education is the vehicle to drive them towards a more promising future. With so many issues, it is my mission as their educator to take them away and rescue them from their pressing worries through the joys of meaningful experiences and exposure to what life has to offer. Our school is 100% poverty, one of two such schools in the state of South Carolina. We don't take this rank as an excuse to have a pity party, but rather as a means of motivation. 


We strive to plant seeds of hope and reassure the students that education is the key that unlocks the doors of opportunity and future success. By understanding that there is more to life than what meets the eye, it is my belief that my students will do what it takes to beat the odds, defy the statistics and embrace the world of education and all it has to offer. 

 <br/><br/>My students need a tape, border and letters to create and display motivational Health & Wellness posters and bulletin boards! We are ready to showcase our Health and Wellness knowledge for all to see. My students will first develop Health and Wellness posters. These posters will serve as a reminder to everyone of healthy habits and rules to follow. These posters will be displayed in and around the school building. 

 <br/><br/>"The physical and emotional health of an entire generation and the economic health and security of our nation is at stake. This isn't the kind of problem that can be solved overnight, but with everyone working together, it can be solved. So, let's move." First Lady Michelle Obama's Move Launch! This project will allow students to promote healthy habits like moving and staying active. We can reach each child, one poster at a time!

proposals.title: I Have ADHD - Doesn't Mean I Can't Learn - Help Me Succeed!
proposals.shortDescription: Every morning begins with the pledge, Preamble to the United States Constitution, and the Learner's Creed. We are a challenging group, that wants to learn and aims to please. I have 20-30 minutes...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need these yoga balls in order to help them stay focused in class while still being able to expend some energy.
proposals.synopsis: Every morning begins with the pledge, Preamble to the United States Constitution, and the Learner's Creed.  We are a challenging group, that wants to learn and aims to please.  I have 20-30 minutes per lesson in each subject and then work in "brain breaks" for the those who need to move around.  <br/><br/>I have a very diverse group of scholars, from all walks of life.  Each of them has a story to tell, some are great, and others could bring one to tears.  My scholars love to compete, therefore, a lot of competition happens in our classroom.  We usually compete during our "brain breaks" and/or independent activities, and the scholars love for the competitions to be girls vs. boys.  Our school is not much different than our classroom.  The teachers and administrators spend long hours with the scholars making sure they are prepared for the next level in their education.  We work as a professional learning community, knocking ideas off of each other and trying to do what is best for our school and community.  I know that our scholars know we love them and want, with every part of us, for them to be successful in life.  Most of my students receive 504 accommodations for ADHD and I have to find different strategies each day to help them remain on target and feel confident. <br/><br/>The scholars will be able to work mentally while their physical bodies are still able to move.  Many of the scholars that have ADHD in my classroom, are not on medication.  These chairs will assist these scholars who are kinesthetic learners to move while they work.  Usually, I will let some of the scholars move while they work, or walk around the classroom when they have completed a task.  Having these yoga balls will replace regular chairs and they can still move while learning. <br/><br/>The scholars' lives will change drastically with this addition to our classroom.  It will improve our classroom environment because less time will be spent on redirection and more time on learning.  I do not want my scholars to think there is anything they cannot achieve with hard work and dedication.  Having these chairs, will help them to feel like they can succeed in completing activities without the need to jump around.

proposals.title: Millionaire's Club
proposals.shortDescription: These four boys are students within the building that have individually worked hard on their own to reach 1 million words read. These four boys have read over 1 million words in this school year....
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need the experience of attending events that they would normally not. They need a trip to the Hank Aaron Stadium and they need to meet successful men of their same race to inspire them for the future.
proposals.synopsis: These four boys are students within the building that have individually worked hard on their own to reach 1 million words read.   <br/><br/>These four boys have read over 1 million words in this school year.  A typical chapter book for an elementary student contains approximately 25,000 words.  These boys have worked very hard at selecting chapter books that are appropriate for their reading level and successfully passing comprehension tests on these books.  They are hard-working boys that have embraced reading and the enjoyment that reading develops in them.  These boys are interested in sports and have never attended a baseball game.   <br/><br/>The trip the boys will receive will be one they will never forget.  They will use the time at the game to meet players, view Hank Aaron's childhood home, and take in the understanding of what hard work and dedication can do.  This trip will also provide the boys with a tangible souvenir of what they accomplished.   <br/><br/>This trip will not only give the boys something they will never do, but it will also build their self-esteem.  These boys will be well-known as the best readers at our school and the ones who earned their trip.

proposals.title: Rolling, Rolling, Rolling (Get Those Kids A Rolling)
proposals.shortDescription: A typical day in my gymnasium is action filled. Students are ready to move from the moment they arrive. My students are very energetic. They love to move. Throughout the building you can observe...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a tumbling ramp and a tumbling mat to learn how to perform basic tumbling skills.   The mats could also be used by the upper elementary students.
proposals.synopsis:
A typical day in my gymnasium is action filled. Students are ready to move from the moment they arrive. <br/><br/>My students are very energetic. They love to move. Throughout the building you can observe the energy. It is not a challenge to get  them into action. Often they cannot get still enough to hear all of the directions. Some of them also love to talk. 

They love to dance. They love to play with balls. They love to run. Many of them love to tumble and roll.

There are over 500 students at our school which includes grades Pre-K through 8th grade. . Half of our students are boys, half are girls.  Roughly 63% of the students are black, 13% white, 13% Hispanic and 10% other. Approximately 40% qualify for a free lunch.

The students at our school love to read. We are a high performing school.  Our school is a place where we all work hard, students and faculty. <br/><br/>The lower elementary students will use a tumbling mat and ramp to learn how to roll. We will learn a forward roll and a backward roll with the aid of the ramp. 

Students in grades 3rd - 5th will be able to use the mat to practice a sequence of rolls. (National PE. standard 1A requires them to perform a movement performance of 5-7 movements. ) <br/><br/>Donations for this project will help tremendously. Mats are very expensive. I have never purchased a ramp. This will be very useful in helping younger students be able to perform the forward and the backward roll. In the past I have either passed through these skills quickly or not even taught them because they were so challenging for so many. This will make it so much easier to gets the students to be successful with the skills.

proposals.title: Pregnancy Prevention
proposals.shortDescription: "Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge." - PLATO<br /><br />I believe that if I give my students the knowledge, they can make informed decisions and have the desire...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need 4 simulation babies to help aid in our Health Education to reduce our pregnancies within the school.
proposals.synopsis:
"Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge." - PLATO

I believe that if I give my students the knowledge, they can make informed decisions and have the desire to succeed. <br/><br/>We are an urban school district with a high graduation and college acceptance rate. Our courses address core knowledge requirements for state exams, but also challenge students to develop their writing and critical thinking skills.  Furthermore, our Senior Option program allows eligible high school seniors the opportunity to engage in community service, internship, employment programs, or take undergraduate coursework at partnering colleges. <br/><br/>Each student will take a Baby home on a rotation basis for the weekend.  They will learn how hard it is to care for an infant as a teenager and the demands an infant will have.  The simulation baby makes it possible for people to practice caring for an infant 24 hours a day, 3 days a week.  Babies cry for care at all hours, day and night. The caregiver determines what the Baby needs: feeding, burping, rocking, diapering. Also, the Baby's computer tracks it's care and safe handling, and provides the teacher with a detailed assessment that is downloaded post-simulation. <br/><br/>The donations will help us expand our health curriculum and give our students a real-life and hands-on experience.  I believe that with this extensive curriculum, the students will have a better understanding about how becoming a teenage parent can impact their future.

completedMatching.name: 100 Women
completedMatching.description: 100 Women in Hedge Funds is proud to support DonorsChoose.org in making a difference in the lives of teachers and students. 100WHF is a global, practitioner-driven non-profit organization serving over 12,000 alternative investment management investors and professionals through educational, professional leverage and philanthropic initiatives.
