proposals.schoolName: Leap Academy University Charter School - Upper School

proposals.title: Focused, Struggling Readers Crave Snacks!
proposals.shortDescription: My students love to devour engaging books, although it's sometimes difficult for them to focus while their stomachs are growling! This year, I'd love to provide my students with the fuel needed to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need snacks and water to help keep focused in the classroom.
proposals.synopsis:
My students love to devour engaging books, although it's sometimes difficult for them to focus while their stomachs are growling! This year, I'd love to provide my students with the fuel needed to stay focused in the classroom. <br/><br/>Our school is a Title I school located in California. The majority of my 6th-8th grade students have been identified as English Language Learners, and all of my students are reading below grade level. While many of my students have learned to appreciate reading, they've expressed that it's sometimes difficult to focus when they're hungry or thirsty. They need fuel to keep them going throughout the school day! <br/><br/>If we are able to receive these materials, the classroom environment will change dramatically. While reading independently, we could have healthy snacks to help them focus until the end of the school day. 

Students also lose out on class time when they need to go to the drinking fountain. By having water and cups in the classroom, this can cut down on wasted time and increase student learning. <br/><br/>These materials can help my students to focus in not just my class, but all their classes. It will show them how eating a proper, healthy snack will build their capacity to make it through, focused, until the end of the day.

proposals.title: "Getting Active" Using the Arts and the Computer
proposals.shortDescription: "As simple as it sounds, we all must try to be the best person we can: by making the best choices, by making the most of the talents we have been given." Mary Lou Retton, US gold medalist in...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a computer for their classroom.
proposals.synopsis:
"As simple as it sounds, we all must try to be the best person we can: by making the best choices, by making the most of the talents we have been given." Mary Lou Retton, US gold medalist in gymnastics.  My students deserve to be the best too. They need to have access to the best technology. <br/><br/>We are a Title I school, which means most of my students receive free or reduced breakfast and lunch. We are also a culturally diverse school.

We strive to help every student to meet their needs. We provide additional materials and health services if needed. We provide backpacks and uniforms to students in need. We instituted academic clubs after school, and pull-out programs to reinforce academics. Because of these additional programs, our students have done well on standardized tests. We have developed a recipe for success. We have a well-rounded specials program where music and art have been brought back and supported after being cut. Having art, music, PE, and computers, helps create the whole child and helps build academics and self-esteem. We are very proud of our students and their achievements. <br/><br/>We will participate in a creative activity where students work together in a cross-curriculum activity that incorporates high order thinking and have to synthesize new information. My students will combine art, reading, writing, and technology. They will research famous athletes using the computer. They will write and discuss about the athletes with their classmates. They will also illustrate an athlete. Students can draw themselves as a famous athlete or just draw the athlete performing. Students will learn about the Olympics, background information of the athlete, healthy choices, "being active," and the dedication needed to participate. I want this activity to inspire students to be the best they can from these athletes. I want my students to see that they have the tools to succeed and not let obstacles get in their way. They will achieve this in a creative way through the arts, health, and this cross-curriculum activity. <br/><br/>I currently have one outdated computer.  I want my students to have access to current technology for all activities in my classroom. They need to have this modality to stay current in today's society and be ready for today's workforce. This is a creative activity motivating students to learn about "being active," and staying healthy. Students will be inspired to make the best choices by making the most in the talents are given. They will be inspired by a creative athlete to achieve this.

proposals.title: Our Students Need Snacks To Help Their Hunger Attacks
proposals.shortDescription: We have discussions about what happened yesterday. We tell them our day is going to be a great day and motivate them to believe it. Many students enter the classroom still hungry or thirsty after...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need snacks, water and sports drinks, and they need donors who can relate to what it feels like to be hungry. Students who are hungry cannot function effectively in class.
proposals.synopsis: We have discussions about what happened yesterday. We tell them our day is going to be a great day and motivate them to believe it.  Many students enter the classroom still hungry or thirsty after gym. We attempt to satisfy their needs by providing something to eat. <br/><br/>My class consists of 9th and a few 10th grade students with behavioral disabilities. Our school consists of students with disabilities. They have problems focusing and cannot sit still.  They travel to our school from different areas. Many students live in foster homes or at a home where one parent is missing. They are wonderful humans who were not treated kindly, therefore they do not trust adults.  We have to fill the gap to make them feel worthwhile and safe. <br/><br/>My students have to take the Regents exams and they cannot function in class when they are hungry.  As teachers, we feel the need to make sure our students are not hungry and our classroom is a place where our students feel loved. Our students love sports and after gym they need water or a sports drink to quench their thirst.  It is important they are not hungry as this can be a problem for the teacher.  The students will leave the classroom and go from classroom to classroom looking for food. <br/><br/>Having snacks in the classroom helps to alleviate disruptive behavior as it helps students to focus on their task. Snacks or food from the cafeteria are the only meals some of our students may have for the day.  Those are the reasons we need donors who can relate to the needs of our students, to donate.  We thank you for your help.

proposals.title: Camping out for Comprehension
proposals.shortDescription: My students come to school full of energy and ready to learn. They can barely sit still long enough to take it all in but when I get them comfortable and focused they are like sponges, soaking it...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need comfortable chairs to sit it so they will be focused on learning. Who wants to sit on hard chairs all day?! No one!
proposals.synopsis: My students come to school full of energy and ready to learn. They can barely sit still long enough to take it all in but when I get them comfortable and focused they are like sponges, soaking it all in! <br/><br/>My students come from high poverty families. They struggle to get the basic necessities of life many times. We are a Title 1 school with a high percentage of free and reduced lunch. Our school is a place where we like to think outside the box and find different ways to reach all students. They are very eager to learn and share what they have learned with others.  <br/><br/>These chairs will help the children be more comfortable when they have to sit for longer periods of time.  It will make sitting longer for test prep easier. They are also great because they are portable. I do a lot of cooperative grouping. This way the students can take their chair and meet with their group at different areas in the classroom.  This will make our book club meeting  easier as they can circle up quickly and comfortably.  It will also make my conference time easier because we can pull up our chairs and meet anywhere in the classroom.  It will also make it easier for my students to get comfortable in a place away from others because they can take their chair and go to a corner and face the wall.  <br/><br/>The more comfortable you are the more you learn. Who wants to sit on a hard plastic chair all day?! Not me! Many of our chairs are broken and the legs are uneven or the plastic has cracked and can easily pinch students legs. If my students felt comfortable they would be able to focus on the activity at hand and not worry about finding a comfortable spot to sit. The more focused on my lesson I can get them the more they will learn and the better they will do on tests and in life!!!

proposals.title: How Does Your Garden Grow?
proposals.shortDescription: With the help of donors just like you, my students and I have been able to create an awesome schoolyard garden. We grow lettuce, radishes, beans, peppers, tomatoes and more. Our challenge is that...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need kitchen tools, measuring cups, mixing bowls, and a salad spinner, so we can prepare the food we are growing in our schoolyard garden.
proposals.synopsis: With the help of donors just like you, my students and I have been able to create an awesome schoolyard garden. We grow lettuce, radishes, beans, peppers, tomatoes and more. Our challenge is that we lack the tools to prepare our delicious veggies once we harvest them. <br/><br/>My students are awesome. They live in a major city, they are almost exclusively part of a minority group, their families usually don't make very much money, and they are farmers! Our schoolyard garden has taken off. We have hundreds of feet of vegetable beds, we have fruit trees, we have a huge pollinator garden, and we have students who take care of it all. My students no longer shriek when they see a praying mantis; instead they call their friends over to check it out. They no longer think that carrots grow on trees, or that you have to buy everything you eat at the corner store. They love the garden, and they are learning as they grow. <br/><br/>As we prepare for spring planting, my students identified a big problem: we don't have the kitchen tools needed to prepare our harvest. While it's true that my students love to garden, it cannot be denied that the part they enjoy the most is eating what we grow. I am requesting things like measuring cups, mixing bowls, and one really big salad spinner so that my students can better connect to the food we grow in the garden. The materials will mean that my students will be engaged in the garden experience from seed to plate and even tummy. The resources will allow me to expand my teaching to include food preparation for my students who are rarely exposed to fresh food and to get them to try fruits and vegetables that some have never even heard of. <br/><br/>I have great students who deserve to know that carrots grow in the ground and that strawberries shouldn't be the size of apples. Our garden program has exposed students in amazing things, and the resources requested in this proposal will take our program to the next level. Thank you for believing in my students and in the mission of public education.

proposals.title: Getting Active in Pre-K!
proposals.shortDescription: "Experts tell us that 90% of all brain development occurs by the age of five. If we don't begin thinking about education in the early years, our children are at risk of falling behind by the time...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Sing and Move CD, Sing and Move Song Bag, and Let's Get Moving! Activity Mats, to help increase their gross motor activity on rainy and severely cold days.
proposals.synopsis: "Experts tell us that 90% of all brain development occurs by the age of five. If we don't begin thinking about education in the early years, our children are at risk of falling behind by the time they start Kindergarten." - Robert. L. Ehrlich <br/><br/>92% of my students receive free or reduced lunch, and over 37% are English language learners! Despite these challenges, we experience joy every day from coming together and working diligently to meet our academic and character development goals. My students believe in themselves and know that I am behind them, cheering them on all the way! Our program is embedded within an elementary school, serving Pre-Kindergarten students, who are at risk of entering school without the skills necessary for success. We have work to do in order to accomplish our goal of having every child ready to succeed in Kindergarten. On rainy days, when we are unable to go outside, my squirmy, sweet, animated students are having trouble paying attention to instruction because they are just bursting with energy- and understandably so! I am requesting indoor gross motor activities that we can use in our classroom. These materials will help my students get their wiggles out so that we can focus and do our work! <br/><br/>In addition to expending energy, my students will be given the benefit of physical activity. Many of my students live in urban areas where they are unable to run and play outside, so if they don't get physical activity at school- they don't get it at all! Getting active and taking care of our bodies must be a priority in addition to academic achievement. Materials such as the Let's Get Moving Activity Mats, Music from Around the World Song Bank and CD, Sing and Move Song Bag and CD,  Swing and Catch Cups, and Parachute will help us accomplish our goals! <br/><br/>It is so important that children are getting active each and every day! I want to ensure that my students' bodies and minds are being enriched while they are at school! Indoor activities that help to expend energy will greatly impact my students by allowing them to focus and learn the skills necessary to succeed in Kindergarten and beyond!

proposals.title: A Healthy Body = A Learning Mind
proposals.shortDescription: "Health is a large word. It embraces not the body only, but the mind and spirit as well," James H. West. Sanitizers and disinfectants will keep us healthy! Everyday one or more of my students are...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need hand sanitizer and disinfectant spray to stay healthy!
proposals.synopsis: "Health is a large word. It embraces not the body only, but the mind and spirit as well," James H. West. Sanitizers and disinfectants will keep us healthy! <br/><br/>Everyday one or more of my students are sick. Germs spread so quick that I find my students not able to concentrate on schoolwork. What makes it worse is that my class is very engaged in collaborative activities. If they were healthy all of the time, we would be able to engage our activities without any worry of spreading germs! <br/><br/>My students will be able to use the hand sanitizer and tissues whenever they pleased during the day. If there is ever a concern about getting sick from another student, it will quickly be put to rest with the use of the sanitizer and disinfectant spray. The spray will be used on desks, tables, and any other place that hands are touched frequently. <br/><br/>Hand sanitizer and disinfectant spray would greatly improve my classroom. Staying healthy is the key to a learning mind. It is hard to concentrate when you are sick. Imagine being stuck in a small room being taught things that you are likely not to remember, all because you are sick. If my students are healthy they can be engaged in collaborative activities and be able to retain the information given to them!

proposals.title: Getting Active with Zumba
proposals.shortDescription: The students at my school are from area of the city where the are sometimes afraid to get outside and become active because of violence in the neighborhood. This project will enable me to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a projector to get active with Zumba.
proposals.synopsis: The students at my school are from area of the city where the are sometimes afraid to get  outside and become active because of violence in the neighborhood. This project will enable me to introduce Zumba to student who wouldn't be active. <br/><br/>Most of my students are not physically active. A lot of my students don't know what Zumba is and how it can help them become physically fit. We have noticed an increase in teenage obesity. It is important to make teens aware how to become physically fit with lifelong activities such as Zumba. Because my students don't have the money to go to a fitness center where Zumba classes are held, they are unable to experience this valuable fitness activity. My school has been a victim of many budget cuts in our district we are unable the get the things needed to help my students become more active. This project is important because this is will help to decrease some of the health issue some of my students are experiencing due to their increase obesity. <br/><br/>The projector will help my students will to see what Zumba looks like as well as participate along with what they are seeing. This project will help decrease childhood obesity and increase the fitness level of many students. The projector gives students who are visual learners the ability to see Zumba in action. My students will be able to share what they have learned in class with there family members and this will increase the family members knowledge. Due to the knowledge that others, have therefore changing the culture of there community and decreasing the risk of obesity. <br/><br/>This project goes beyond my class once students are informed they are able to share what they have learned with their  family therefore helping to decrease obesity. This project is a valuable tool for the class students will gain experience they wouldn't normally exposed to.

proposals.title: Get Up and Move!
proposals.shortDescription: Have you tried to exercise without music? Music can motivate students to get up and move. Music helps keep pace for running laps or repetitions with weights and even holding stretches. For...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need an mp3 player to play music and a speaker to listen with.
proposals.synopsis: Have you tried to exercise without music? Music can motivate students to get up and move. Music helps keep pace for running laps or repetitions with weights and even holding stretches. For students who are not excited about movement, it may offer a source of encouragement and mental inspiration. <br/><br/>My students are both male and female teenagers in grades 9-12. We are a culturally diverse campus with 2700 students. I interact with 250 students a day which includes, general education, athletes, and special education students. Most of these students are trying to earn credits to graduate high school. Other students are working towards a healthier lifestyle and chose Physical Education as their elective class. I also teach Specially Designed Physical Education to students with special needs. <br/><br/>I am requesting a portable speaker and mp3 player to play music for students indoor and outdoors. The music will be used to motivate students during cardiovascular activity and during warm ups. We also have a dance unit each year. The music will be positive in hopes to inspire and start class in good spirits. The device will also used to administer state fitness tests. Students will be able to exercise and move with a smile. <br/><br/>Music creates memories. What better way to create memories that may lead to a healthier lifestyle. Students will think of exercise as a fun and positive activity. Music has the ability to also lower anxiety and bring students together.

proposals.title: Healthy Esteem
proposals.shortDescription: With fast food restaurants on nearly every corner in Brooklyn, my students continue to fight the battle with obesity which leads them to poor self confidence. With these fitness products we will...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need weights to help build strength, jump ropes for cardio, and resistance bands to explore alternative ways to build muscle and enhance self esteem.
proposals.synopsis: With fast food restaurants on nearly every corner in Brooklyn, my students continue to fight the battle with obesity which leads them to poor self confidence. With these fitness products we will be able to work out and become strong both physically and emotionally. <br/><br/>My students are young females who struggle with self esteem due to poor eating habits and fitness routines. Our school is located in inner city Brooklyn, where they major in performing arts. All females are bright young women whom are unhappy within their skin, and tend to shy away from cameras, and presentations in class. <br/><br/>This program will help them learn a healthier way of life through the importance of daily exercise and a nutritional plan. We will create daily routines with free weights, kettle bell weights, resistance bands, jump ropes, and a weighted bar to build their strength, techniques which they can also utilize at home. This will help them to feel better in health and mind. <br/><br/>I believe this donation will help my students enhance their self esteem which in turn will make them feel more confident within themselves  to not shy away from opportunities to speak or perform in class.

proposals.title: We Can Learn About Healthy Eating Choices Around the World!
proposals.shortDescription: "The early years are when you give your child a foundation for establishing a proper diet. If kids learn about the importance of eating healthy early in their lives, they will not have to relearn...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a grocery set, multicultural play foods, dressing vests, books, and puzzles to learn about healthy eating choices around the world.
proposals.synopsis: "The early years are when you give your child a foundation for establishing a proper diet. If kids learn about the importance of eating healthy early in their lives, they will not have to relearn as an adult." ~ Nicole Henderson <br/><br/>The students in my central Illinois classroom are three, four and five-years-old. All have been identified as "at-risk" through a developmental screening. They each have a need in one or more of the following areas: language, cognitive, motor, and social. Some have non-English speaking parents. Many live in low-income homes. <br/><br/>The community sorting set will help children learn about community helpers such as doctors, nurses, teachers, fire fighters, police, etc. The multicultural food set and grocery store set will help children learn about a variety of healthy foods. Children will learn to express their feelings by working with the Emotions mirrors. They will learn about foods, customs, clothing, and more by reading the 12 books about children around the world and assembling the children around the world puzzle. By working with the multicultural materials, the children will also develop a better understanding of the cultures represented in our school community. <br/><br/>Your donation will provide materials to help children develop healthy eating habits, awareness of cultures, and vocabulary related to names of foods. Thank you for considering a donation to our project!

proposals.title: ADL Skills Essential For Student Independence
proposals.shortDescription: Help turn our classroom into a culinary experience! Our students require basic cooking skills which will enable them to maximize their independence post secondary school. Learning to cook will...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need materials, such as a cook top and skillet, magic bullet blender, electric griddle, knifes and toaster oven in order to learn basic meal preparation.
proposals.synopsis: Help turn our classroom into a culinary experience! Our students require basic cooking skills which will enable them to maximize their independence post secondary school. Learning to cook will enable them to pursue possible employment opportunities in the area of meal preparation. <br/><br/>My students are functional and developmental disabled students who have a variety of severe disabilities. They have various food specific allergies, nutrition and dietary plans which set limitations on things that they can and cannot eat. Learning to prepare basic meals that fit their specific needs will maximize their independence and decrease their reliance. Learning meal preparation will also allow for them to make meals that they love with accommodations as well as healthier alternatives. <br/><br/>Through the funded items, students will become familiar with related vocabulary, uses for specific utensils and be able to follow multi-step directions, which will also be useful in other areas of learning. Students will learn how to utilize items within the simulated classroom kitchen which can prepare them for life post secondary school, whether they remain living at home with family, group homes or for future employment opportunities. I have requested items such as a blender which will enable students who can only consume pureed foods, to learn how to make various combinations and develop their own recipes. Students will also learn healthy alternatives to making basic foods using a griddle and hot plate to prepare meats in the appropriate way. A refrigerator for storing perishable materials. The toaster oven will allow students to make healthy pizzas and flat breads. Students will use knives, bowls, forks and spatulas to become familiar with the use of these items. <br/><br/>It is essential that students learn healthy and safe methods for preparing their meals. Through hands-on experience, students will develop necessary skills on meal preparation, kitchen safety, following instruction and multi-step directions. Students can learn acquired skills independently and in pursuit of future employment/volunteer opportunities post secondary school. Students learning to cook will boost their confidence, motivation and of course they will have fun!!

proposals.title: Sensory Break Items
proposals.shortDescription: My students participate in core reading and math classes and receive interventions and breaks within my unit. We have a daily social skill activity where students are learning calming strategies...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need sensory items that consist of  Play-Doh, soft blocks, painting/brushes, and stamps for breaks to help be successful in their regular education classes.
proposals.synopsis: My students participate in core reading and math classes and receive interventions and breaks within my unit. We have a daily social skill activity where students are learning calming strategies as well as engaging learning in a team atmosphere using multi-sensory approach. <br/><br/>My students are a ball of energy that have the greatest smiles. Each student is on an IEP that address social and academic needs. Students are each on a daily positive point sheet that encourages positive peer interactions as well as social skills. 90% of the students are on free and reduce lunch in my room and come from different neighborhoods in a large school district. The age range of students are 5 to 9 years old. <br/><br/>My students take sensory breaks in their daily schedule outside of their regular classroom to help encourage positive behaviors as well as provide a fun multi-sensory learning environment. Students use the sensory items that include Play-Doh, paint, stamps, and exercise equipment during sensory breaks that allow students to move. Sensory breaks also creates a  calm, healthy learning experience. Students are able to use the items to practice breaks to use in real-life experiences as well.  <br/><br/>The materials in this project will allow students to a multi-sensory break experiences to help prepare for a safe learning experience. Students will be able to have a practice expressing their feelings in a safe way as well allow increase healthy living. Students with special needs are able to take sensory breaks to help limit anxiety in class and help create a focus, calm learning environment. Sensory breaks allows for a healthy environment for students to use in real-life situations as well.
